de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.forte.comm

Interface ICommunicationLayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCommunicationLayer, CommFunctionBlockLayer, ForteDataBufferLayer, IPcommunicationLayer, TCPclientCommLayer, TCPcommunicationLayer, TCPserverCommLayer, UDPcommunicationLayer, UDPpublisherCommLayer, UDPsubscriberCommLayer

    public interface ICommunicationLayer
    Provides the public interface for an OSI layer. Loosely based on the OSI layer interface implemented in FORTE.
    Author:
    Marc Jakobi

    HTW Berlin

    July 2017
    See Also:
    FORTE communication architecture

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean closeConnection()
      Closes this layer and calls closeConnection() on the layer below.
      ICommunicationLayer getAbove() 
      ICommunicationLayer getBelow() 
      boolean getConnectionState() 
      byte[] getRawBytes() 
      boolean openConnection(CommLayerParams params)
      Opens the connection and sets up the communication stack.
      byte readByte()
      Reads a byte from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
      double readDouble()
      Reads 8 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
      float readFloat()
      Reads 4 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
      long readLong()
      Reads 4 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
      void recvData()
      Performs the necessary actions for receiving data.
      void sendData(byte[] data)
      Performs the necessary actions for sending data.

      Performs the necessary actions for sending data.
      void setAbove(ICommunicationLayer layer)
      Sets the communication layer above this layer.
      void setBelow(ICommunicationLayer layer)
      Sets the communication layer below this layer.

    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        boolean openConnection(CommLayerParams params)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the connection and sets up the communication stack. If necessary, additional layers below this layer are created.
        Parameters:
        params - CommLayerParams object holding the connection info
        Returns:
        true if the connection was opened successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeConnection

        boolean closeConnection()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this layer and calls closeConnection() on the layer below.
        Returns:
        true if the connection was closed successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendData

        void sendData(byte[] data,
              int off,
              int len)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Performs the necessary actions for sending data.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte array containing the data
        Offset - (start of write operation)
        len - Length of the data to be sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendData

        void sendData(byte[] data)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Performs the necessary actions for sending data. Equivalent to calling sendData(data, 0, data.length);
        Parameters:
        data - Byte array containing the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • recvData

        void recvData()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Performs the necessary actions for receiving data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAbove

        ICommunicationLayer getAbove()
        Returns:
        the communication layer above this layer

      • getBelow

        ICommunicationLayer getBelow()
        Returns:
        the communication layer below this layer

      • setAbove

        void setAbove(ICommunicationLayer layer)
        Sets the communication layer above this layer.

      • setBelow

        void setBelow(ICommunicationLayer layer)
        Sets the communication layer below this layer.

      • readByte

        byte readByte()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a byte from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readLong

        long readLong()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads 4 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
        Returns:
        the long value represented by the 4 bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readDouble

        double readDouble()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads 8 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
        Returns:
        the double value represented by the 8 bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readFloat

        float readFloat()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads 4 bytes from the communication layer below or the connected device if this layer is the bottom layer.
        Returns:
        the float value represented by the 4 bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getConnectionState

        boolean getConnectionState()
        Returns:
        true if the layer is connected, false otherwise.

      • getRawBytes

        byte[] getRawBytes()
        Returns:
        a byte array holding the raw data retrieved by calling recvData()
